entry.headline: Terex to Present at J.P. Morgan Diversified Industries Conference
entry.body: WESTPORT, Conn.--(Business Wire)-- Terex Corporation (NYSE: TEX) today announced that it will participate in the J.P. Morgan Diversified Industries Conference at the J.P. Morgan Conference Center at 383 Madison Avenue in New York City on Wednesday, September 16, 2009. The meeting will include a presentation at 1:30 PM EDT by Ronald DeFeo, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer and Tom Gelston, Vice President, Investor Relations. A live webcast and slide presentation from this conference can be accessed on the Terex Corporation website, www.terex.com, under the Investor Relations section. Listeners should go to this site at least 15 minutes before this event to download and install any necessary audio software. For those unable to listen to the live broadcast, a replay will be available by accessing the above address. Terex Corporation is a diversified global manufacturer with 2008 net sales of $9.9 billion. Terex operates in four business segments: Terex Aerial Work Platforms, Terex Construction, Terex Cranes, and Terex Materials Processing & Mining. Terex manufactures a broad range of equipment for use in various industries, including the construction, infrastructure, quarrying, surface mining, shipping, transportation, refining and utility industries. Terex offers a complete line of financial products and services to assist in the acquisition of Terex equipment through Terex Financial Services. Terex uses its website to make information available to its investors and the market at www.terex.com. Terex Corporation Tom Gelston, 203-222-5943 Vice President, Investor Relations thomas.gelston@terex.com or Kurt Goddard, 203-222-6160 Senior Manager, Investor Relations kurt.goddard@terex.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.author: None
entry.headline: ExxonMobil annonce la finalisation du financement du projet Gorgon
entry.body: IRVING, Texas--(Business Wire)-- Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE : XOM) a annoncé aujourd`hui que le développement du projet de gaz naturel liquéfié (GNL) Gorgon avait été approuvé par les participants au projet. La décision finale d`investissement dans Gorgon a été annoncée par des représentants de la co-entreprise Gorgon (ExxonMobil 25 % de participation, Shell 25 % de participation, et Chevron 50 % de participation et qui en est l`exploitant) lors d`une cérémonie qui a eu lieu à Perth en présence du Premier Ministre d`Australie occidentale, Monsieur Colin Barnett, MLA, et du Ministre fédéral des ressources et de l`énergie, Monsieur Martin Ferguson, MP. Cette décision fait suite à l`exécution récente d'accords de vente et d`achat de GNL avec PetroChina International Company Limited et Petronet LNG Limited, de l`Inde, relativement à l`action participative au GNL d`ExxonMobil dans le projet Gorgon. « Étant donné que la demande mondiale en GNL promet de tripler d`ici à 2030, le projet Gorgon constituera une source d`approvisionnement essentielle pour satisfaire aux futurs besoins en GNL, et notamment ceux des économies de la région en pleine croissance d`Asie-Pacifique », a déclaré Neil Duffin, président d`ExxonMobil Development Company. « La fourniture de gaz naturel, à combustion plus propre, jouera également un rôle essentiel pour minimiser les émissions globales ». D`après M. Duffin, la décision d`investissement finale dans Gorgon constitue un événement marquant. « Du fait de son engagement dans le projet Gorgon ainsi que dans le développement continu des champs de pétrole et de gaz de classe mondiale de l`Australie dans le Détroit de Bass, ExxonMobil demeure un contributeur majeur au développement énergétique et au progrès économique de l`Australie », a-t-il déclaré. « La société ExxonMobil est fière de participer au projet Gorgon avec ses partenaires de co-entreprise, Chevron et Shell. Ensemble, avec le soutien du gouvernement fédéral de l`Australie et du gouvernement d`état de l`Australie occidentale, nous nous sommes engagés à mener à bon terme le développement des ressources Gorgon, qui comprend un projet de capture et de stockage de CO2 à grande échelle ». Le projet de GNL Gorgon fait partie du portefeuille croissant de projets d`ExxonMobil visant à satisfaire les besoins en énergie de l`Australie et du reste du monde. Les ressources de la zone élargie de Gorgon sont estimées à 40 billions de pieds cube de gaz naturel. Les premières ventes de GNL sont prévues pour 2014 et celle de gaz domestique en 2015. À propos d`ExxonMobil ExxonMobil, la plus grande société internationale de pétrole et de gaz cotée en bourse, utilise la technologie et l`innovation afin de répondre aux besoins croissants en énergie du monde. ExxonMobil possède un portefeuille de ressources qui en fait le leader du secteur, est le plus grand raffineur et le plus grand vendeur de produits pétroliers, et sa société chimique est l`une des plus importantes au monde. Pour de plus amples informations, consulter le site www.exxonmobil.com. ExxonMobil en Australie ExxonMobil est la plus grande société d`énergie intégrée d`Australie et emploie près de 1 700 personnes dans l`exploration, la production, le marketing et le raffinage de pétrole et de gaz ainsi que la manufacture de lubrifiants et de produits chimiques. L'histoire commerciale d`ExxonMobil en Australie remonte à plus de 110 ans. La société a joué un rôle significatif dans le développement des ressources pétrolières de l`Australie et a célébré cette année 40 ans de production pétrolière et gazière dans le Détroit de Bass. ExxonMobil exploite 21 plateformes et installations de forage en mer dans le Détroit de Bass ainsi que les usines de traitement de gaz et de stabilisation de pétrole brut de Longford et l`usine de traitement de GNL de Long Island Point. En 2008, ExxonMobil a annoncé le développement des projets Kipper et Turrum dans le Détroit de Bass. En Australie occidentale, outre le développement de Gorgon, la société détient une participation directe de 50 % et est l`exploitant du champ de gaz de Scarborough, qui en est aux stades précoces de planification du développement des ressources. AVERTISSEMENT : les énoncés contenus dans ce communiqué relatifs aux plans, attentes, événements ou conditions futurs constituent des énoncés prospectifs. Les résultats réels, y compris les plans du projet, l`impact de nouvelles technologies, et la croissance de la demande, pourront varier sensiblement en réponse aux changements des cours à long terme du pétrole et du gaz ou autres conditions du marché affectant l`industrie du pétrole et du gaz ; les événements ou changements politiques ; les actions des concurrents ; l`achèvement dans les délais prescrits des projets de développement ; l`aboutissement des négociations commerciales ; et autres facteurs traités sous la rubrique « Factors Affecting Future Results » dans la section « Investors » de notre site Web (www.exxonmobil.com) et dans l`Article 1A du formulaire 10 K le plus récent d`ExxonMobil. Les références aux volumes de gaz naturel incluent des quantités qui ne sont pas encore classées en tant que réserves prouvées mais qui, à notre avis, seront produites en dernier ressort. Le texte du communiqué issu d`une traduction ne doit d`aucune manière être considéré comme officiel. La seule version du communiqué qui fasse foi est celle du communiqué dans sa langue d`origine. La traduction devra toujours être confrontée au texte source, qui fera jurisprudence. ExxonMobil Relations avec les médias en amont, +1 713-656-4376 ou ExxonMobil Australie Richard Ellis, +61 8 9320 5436 Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Exxon says breakdown repaired at California refinery
entry.body:
HOUSTON, Sept 14 (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N) said a mechanical breakdown in a processing unit at its 150,000 barrel per day (bpd) Los Angeles-area refinery in Torrance, California, was repaired on Monday and the unit was operating normally.

The breakdown had a "minor impact to production," said Exxon spokeswoman Carolin Keith. She declined to identify the unit involved. (Reporting by Erwin Seba)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: ExxonMobil anuncia financiamento integral do Projeto Gorgon
entry.body: IRVING, Texas--(Business Wire)-- A Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE:XOM) anunciou hoje que o desenvolvimento do Projeto Gorgon de gás natural liquefeito (GNL) foi aprovado por seus participantes. A decisão final sobre o investimento no Gorgon foi anunciada por representantes da joint-venture Gorgon (Exxon Mobil com 25% de participação; Shell com 25% de participação; e Chevron com 25% de participação e função de operadora), em cerimônia realizada em Perth, da qual participou o Primeiro Ministro da Austrália Ocidental, Colin Barnett, e o Ministro de Recursos e Energia, Martin Ferguson. A decisão segue-se à recente realização de acordos de compra e venda de GNL com a PetroChina International Company Limited e a Petronet LNG Limited of India para a parte de GNL da ExxonMobil no Projeto Gorgon. "Com a previsão de demanda global por gás natural liquefeito triplicada até 2030, o Projeto Gorgon será uma fonte de suprimento fundamental para atender à demanda futura, principalmente nas economias em rápido crescimento da região da Ásia-Pacífico ", disse Neil Duffin, presidente da ExxonMobil Development Company. "O fornecimento de gás natural de queima mais limpa será também essencial para ajudar a minimizar as emissões globais." Duffin afirmou que a decisão final de investir no Gorgon é um marco importante. "Com o nosso compromisso com o Projeto Gorgon, associado ao contínuo desenvolvimento dos campos de gás e petróleo australianos de categoria internacional em Bass Strait, a ExxonMobil continua a dar relevante contribuição para o desenvolvimento energético e o progresso econômico da Austrália", disse ele. "A ExxonMobil orgulha-se de participar no Projeto Gorgon com os nossos associados nessa empreitada, a Chevron e Shell. Juntos, e com o apoio dos governos da Austrália e da Austrália Ocidental, estamos comprometidos com o desenvolvimento bem sucedido dos recursos do Gorgon, que incluem um projeto de captura e armazenamento de carbono de larga escala." O Projeto Gorgon de GNL faz parte de uma carteira em crescimento da ExxonMobil que ajuda a atender às necessidades da Austrália e dos demais países do mundo. Estima-se que a maior área do Gorgon tenha mais de 1.132 quatrilhões de litros de gás natural. O objetivo é realizar as primeiras vendas de GNL em 2014 e as de gás para uso doméstico em 2015. Sobre a ExxonMobil A ExxonMobil, a maior empresa internacional de petróleo e gás de capital aberto, utiliza tecnologia e inovação para ajudar a atender às crescentes necessidades energéticas do mundo. A ExxonMobil mantém um inventário de recursos líderes no setor, é a maior refinaria e comerciante de produtos derivados do petróleo e sua empresas química é uma das maiores do mundo. Para obter mais informações, acesse www.exxonmobil.com. ExxonMobil na Austrália A ExxonMobil é a terceira maior empresa de energia integrada da Austrália, onde emprega cerca de 1.700 pessoas nas áreas de exploração de gás, produção, comercialização e refino, além de fabricação de lubrificantes e produtos químicos. O histórico da ExxonMobil na Austrália estende-se por mais de cento e dez anos. A empresa desempenhou papel significativo no desenvolvimento dos recursos petrolíferos da Austrália e, neste ano, celebra quarenta anos de produção de petróleo e gás em Bass Strait. A ExxonMobil opera vinte e uma plataformas offshore e instalações em Bass Strait, além das usinas de processamento de gás e de estabilização de óleo cru de Longford e da usina de processamento de gás liquefeito do petróleo de Long Island Point. Em 2008, a ExxonMobil anunciou o desenvolvimento dos projetos Kipper e Turrum, em Bass Strait. Na Austrália Ocidental, além do desenvolvimento do Gorgon, a empresa detém 50% de participação operacional e é a operadora do campo de gás de Scarborough, atualmente nos estágios iniciais de planejamento de desenvolvimento de recursos. DECLARAÇÃO CAUTELAR: declarações relativas a planos, expectativas, eventos ou condições futuras constituem declarações sobre desempenho futuro. Os resultados futuros efetivos, incluindo planos relacionados com projetos, o impacto de novas tecnologias e o crescimento da demanda podem divergir substancialmente em razão de alterações no longo prazo dos preços e das condições que afetam o setor de petróleo e gás, eventos ou mudanças políticas, ações de concorrentes, conclusão em tempo hábil de projetos de desenvolvimento, resultado de negociações comerciais e outros fatores discutidos sob o título "Fatores que afetam resultados futuros", na seção "Investidores" do nosso site. (www.exxonmobil.com) e no item 1A do mais recente formulário 10-K da ExxonMobil. Referências a volumes de gás natural incluem quantidades ainda não classificadas como reservas provadas, mas que acreditamos que virão a ser produzidas. O texto no idioma original deste anúncio é a versão oficial autorizada. As traduções são fornecidas apenas como uma facilidade e devem se referir ao texto no idioma original, que é a única versão do texto que tem efeito legal. entry.headline: ExxonMobil gibt vollständige Finanzierung von Gorgon bekannt
entry.body: IRVING, Texas (USA)--(Business Wire)-- Die Exxon Mobil Corporation (NYSE: XOM) hat heute bekannt gegeben, dass das Flüssigerdgasprojekt (LNG, Liquefied Natural Gas) Gorgon durch die Projektbeteiligten zur Erschließung zugelassen wurde. Die letztendliche Investitionsentscheidung für Gorgon wurde von Vertretern des Gorgon-Joint-Ventures (Anteil ExxonMobil 25 Prozent, Anteil Shell 25 Prozent und Anteil Chevron als Betreiber 50 Prozent) anlässlich einer Zeremonie in Perth bekanntgegeben, an der auch der Premierminister von Westaustralien, Hon. Colin Barnett MLA und der Bundesminister für Ressourcen und Energie, Hon. Martin Ferguson MP teilnahmen. Die Entscheidung folgte dem vor Kurzem erfolgten Abschluss von LNG-Kaufverträgen mit der PetroChina International Company Limited und der indischen Petronet LNG Limited über den Anteil von ExxonMobil am Flüssigerdgas im Rahmen des Gorgon-Projekts. „Laut Prognosen wird sich die weltweite Nachfrage nach Flüssigerdgas bis zum Jahr 2030 verdreifachen. Damit wird das Gorgon-Projekt zu einer maßgeblichen Bezugsquelle bei der Erfüllung dieser zukünftigen Nachfrage, insbesondere in den Ländern des schnellwachsenden Wirtschaftsraums Asien-Pazifik", sagte Neil Duffin, President der ExxonMobil Development Company. „Die Lieferung von sauberer verbrennendem Erdgas wird darüber hinaus dazu beitragen, die weltweiten Emissionen zu reduzieren." Duffin sagte, dass die letztendliche Investitionsentscheidung über das Gorgon-Projekt ein bedeutender Meilenstein sei. „Durch unseren Einsatz für das Gorgon-Projekt und die kontinuierliche Erschließung der erstklassigen australischen Öl- und Gasfelder in der Bass-Straße leistet ExxonMobil weiterhin einen wichtigen Beitrag zur Energieentwicklung und zum wirtschaftlichen Fortschritt in Australien", fügte er hinzu. „ExxonMobil ist stolz darauf, sich mit seinen Partnern Chevron und Shell am Gorgon-Projekt beteiligen zu können. Gemeinsam und mit der Unterstützung durch die australische und westaustralische Regierung haben wir uns der erfolgreichen Erschließung der Gorgon-Ressourcen verschrieben, wozu auch ein großangelegtes CO2-Abscheidungs- und -speicherungsprojekt gehört." Das Gorgon-LNG-Projekt ist Teil eines wachsenden ExxonMobil-Portfolios, das dazu beiträgt, den Energiebedarf in Australien und dem Rest der Welt zu decken. Im Großraum des Gorgon-Bereiches gibt es schätzungsweise 1,13 Billionen Kubikmeter Erdgas. Erste LNG-Umsätze sind für 2014 und Erdgas-Verkäufe für 2015 geplant. Über ExxonMobil ExxonMobil, das größte börsennotierte internationale Öl- und Gasunternehmen, nutzt Technologien und Innovationen, um dazu beizutragen, dass der weltweit wachsende Energiebedarf gedeckt wird. ExxonMobil verfügt über eine branchenführende Fülle an Ressourcen, ist der größte Veredler und Vermarkter von Mineralölprodukten und sein Chemieunternehmen ist eines der größten der Welt. Weitere Informationen erhalten Sie unter www.exxonmobil.com. ExxonMobil in Australien ExxonMobil ist das größte integrierte Energieversorgungsunternehmen in Australien und beschäftigt etwa 1.700 Mitarbeiter in den Bereichen Öl- und Gasexploration, -produktion, -marketing und -raffination sowie in der Fertigung von Schmierstoffen und chemischen Produkten. Die Firmengeschichte von ExxonMobil in Australien erstreckt sich über 110 Jahre. Das Unternehmen hat bei der Erschließung der australischen Erdölressourcen eine bedeutende Rolle gespielt und feierte in diesem Jahr das 40-jährige Jubiläum der Öl- und Gasförderung in der Bass-Straße. ExxonMobil betreibt 21 Offshore-Plattformen und Anlagen in der Bass-Straße sowie die Gasaufbereitungs- und Rohölstabilisierungsanlagen in Longford und die LPG-Aufbereitungsanlage in Long Island Point. 2008 kündigte ExxonMobil die Erschließung der Projekte Kipper und Turrum in der Bass-Straße an. In Westaustralien verfügt das Unternehmen neben der Entwicklung des Gorgon-Projektes, über einen 50-prozentigen Working Interest am Scarborough-Gasfeld, dessen Betreiber es auch ist und das sich in der Anfangsphase der Ressourcenentwicklungsplanung befindet. RECHTLICHER HINWEIS: Aussagen in dieser Veröffentlichung, die sich auf zukünftige Pläne, Erwartungen, Ereignisse oder Bedingungen beziehen, sind zukunftsgerichtete Aussagen. Die tatsächlichen Ergebnisse, einschließlich der Projektpläne, der Auswirkungen neuer Technologien und des Anstiegs der Nachfrage können maßgeblich von diesen abweichen, und zwar aufgrund von Veränderungen der langfristigen Öl- beziehungsweise Gaspreise oder anderer die Öl- und Gasindustrie betreffenden Marktbedingungen, aufgrund politischer Ereignisse oder Änderungen, Aktionen von Wettbewerbern, des rechtzeitigen Abschlusses von Erschließungsprojekten, der Ergebnisse geschäftlicher Verhandlungen und anderer Faktoren, die auf unserer Website unter der Überschrift „Factors Affecting Future Results" („Die zukünftigen Ergebnisse beeinflussende Faktoren") sowie im Bereich „Investors" („Investoren") auf unserer Website (www.exxonmobil.com) und unter Nummer 1A des Formblatts 10-K von ExxonMobil beschrieben sind. entry.headline: Salesforce.com vs. Microsoft CRM Demo Returns
entry.body: CHARLOTTE, N.C.--(Business Wire)-- Customer Connect (www.customer-connect.com) announces that they are bringing back their Success Accelerators (www.successaccelerators.com) webinar, "Salesforce.com vs. Microsoft CRM: Side-by-Side Demo." This webinar, originally delivered on May 28th, had over 300 registrants with numerous requests for a follow-up webinar. The webinar will pit the world`s most popular Customer Relationship Management (CRM) applications, Salesforce.com (www.salesforce.com) and Microsoft CRM (http://crm.dynamics.com), against each other in a battle to the death. "As the economy starts to come back in many sectors, we`re experiencing increasing demand to help businesses decide which of these two leading CRM tools is the best fit to help them accelerate their operation," says Geoff Ables, CEO of Customer Connect. "After our first webinar on this topic," adds company COO and CRM Practice Leader Matt Wittemann, "we heard a lot of feedback that the material was too technical for many business decision makers, yet not technical enough for IT decision makers. So in this webinar, we are going to focus on the end user. The content will be non-technical and focused on the user experience." "Salesforce.com and Microsoft CRM - Side-by-Side Demo" will begin at 12:30 p.m. EST on September 24th. Those interested may register at www.successaccelerators.com. Computer requirements are at least Windows 2000 for PC users and at least Mac OS X 10.4 or newer. Founded in 2000, Customer Connect Associates helps companies get customers faster and keep them longer by using their unique LUCK process for creating more profitable relationships. Clients include Travelocity, SAS, LandAmerica, AMF, BB, MedImpact, Jacobsen, AAA, Cardinal Health, Covelight Systems, Sunbelt Rentals, Barnhardt Manufacturing, Horry Telephone Cooperative, the Town of Matthews and the City of Statesville. For more information, please visit www.customer-connect.com. Customer Connect Associates, Inc. Jerod Brown, 704-895-2500, ext. 125 www.customer-connect.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.author: Michael Szabo
entry.headline: JPMorgan to buy EcoSecurities for $204 million
entry.body:
LONDON (Reuters) - JPMorgan Chase Co agreed to buy carbon offset aggregator EcoSecurities for 122.9 million pounds ($204 million) on Monday, trumping a bid from the firm's co-founder, to boost its carbon-credit trading business.

J.P.Morgan Ventures Energy Corp., a subsidiary of the bank, said its 100 pence-a-share bid, made through Carbon Acquisition Company, had the backing of shareholders representing 19.9 percent of the company.

It said EcoSecurities had successfully realized value from sourcing, developing and trading emission reductions, and it noted the firm had recorded its first period of profitability in the first half.

The offer represents a 120 percent premium to the group's share price before the start of the offer period on June 4.

"It looks like JPMorgan is backing the current management to take the business private," said Ken Rumph, an equity analyst at Nomura Code.

Ireland-based EcoSecurities Group Plc develops clean energy projects under the Kyoto Protocol's Clean Development Mechanism, which allows companies to export cuts in greenhouse gas emissions to emerging countries like China and India, where such reductions are cheaper to make.

EcoSecurities shares were up 11.5 percent at 101.5 pence by 1411 GMT (10:11 a.m. EDT).

Carbon Acquisition Company said the acceptances included 13.6 million shares held by current and former directors and 9.9 million shares owned by Credit Suisse.

In the offer statement, Carbon Acquisition said the acceptances would remain binding in the event of a competing offer being made.

"It's a scorched earth, blocking tactic (and) it's a problem for Guanabara if these blocking minority figures are holding out," Rumph added.

EcoSecurities rebuffed on September 1 a revised 90 pence-a-share offer from Guanabara Holdings, set up by EcoSecurities co-founder and former president Pedro Moura Costa.

The board of Guanabara said Monday afternoon it noted Carbon Acquisition's offer and will make a further announcement following a review of its own position.

"It remains to be seen if Guanabara will improve its offer and bid something closer to our 'bare-bones' valuation of 114 pence per share," said Mirabaud's Agustin Hochschild.

In July, Guanabara reached a deal with then rival bidder EDF Trading, a unit of French utility EDF, offering it the option to purchase a portion of EcoSecurities' pre-2012 offset portfolio if Guanabara's bid was successful.

($1=.6027 Pound)

entry.headline: Nevion Unveils Complete JPEG2000 Technology for IP, SDH and Fiber Overlay Transport at IBC
entry.body: http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20090914006187/en VS901 Series Offers Lowest Latency, Highest Quality and Greenest Compression Solutions across All Networks SANDEFJORD, Norway & OXNARD, Calif.--(Business Wire)-- Nevion (www.nevion.com), a leading video transport solution provider for broadcasters, telecommunications service providers and government entities worldwide, demonstrated the full capabilities of its new VS901 family of Ventura products at IBC. The highly flexible compression and decompression JPEG2000 solutions provide broadcasters with the lowest latency, highest quality and most powerful signal transport over any network. New VS901 Video Codec Solutions VS901-SED-12 JPEG2000 Compression over STM-4 / OC-12 VS901-TAED-27 JPEG2000 Compression over ASI / SDTI VS901-IED-GE JPEG2000 Compression over IP Three Ventura 901 solutions provide visually lossless compression for contribution and primary distribution applications where compression had previously not been allowed. With JPEG2000 compression at the contribution level, downstream distribution quality encoders with low bit rate outputs are now fed with the highest quality video signals for increased compression efficiency. The result is improved efficiency throughout the entire video transmission and distribution chain. VS901 modules provide maximum integration and fewer components through use of state-of-the-art FPGAs, resulting in the lowest power consumption and highest port density in the industry. VS901-TAED-27 The ASI/SDTI version of the VS901 family of JPEG2000 encoder/decoders provides a single platform that can be user configured as a JPEG2000 encoder, or as a JPEG2000 decoder, and to have the JPEG2000 video transported over selectable interfaces to both 270 Mbps DVB-ASI or SDTI transport. Designed as a true network interface, VS901-TAED-27 encoder accepts HD-SDI, SDI, SDTI, or DVB-ASI at its inputs and automatically detect between these formats applying JPEG2000 compression as needed. VS901-SED-12 The SDH/SONET version of the VS901 family of JPEG2000 encoder/decoders provides a single platform that can be user configured as a JPEG2000 encoder or as a JPEG2000 decoder over a 622Mbps STM-4 / OC-12c network interface. The VS901-SED-12 accepts a single channel of HD-SDI which is JPEG2000 compressed or two channels of SDI, SDTI, or DVB-ASI by passing JPEG2000 compression behaving as a true two channel 270 Mbps multiplexer. VS901-IED-GE The IP version of the VS901 family of JPEG2000 encoder/decoders provides a single platform that can be user configured as a JPEG2000 encoder or as a JPEG2000 decoder over a 100/1000 Base-T Ethernet network interface. The VS901-IED-GE encoder can accept HD-SDI, SDI, SDTI, and DVB-ASI at its inputs and auto detect between these formats, automatically applying JPEG2000 compression as needed. In addition, the VS901-IED-GE is entirely SMPTE 2022 compliant for the encapsulation of MPEG-2 Transport Streams over IP with Forward Error Correction. Recent industry developments point to the growing importance of JPEG2000 technology and Nevion`s position in that growth. "Increased development in contribution video, primary distribution and archiving, along with its use in digital cinema, have contributed to the wide acceptance of JPEG2000," said Dr. Chin Koh, director of product management for Nevion`s Ventura product family. "In addition to creating the most scalable and flexible JPEG2000 solutions, Nevion is currently active on committees across the industry to establish JPEG2000 standards across networks and applications." The VS901 series features the lowest constant latency for a guaranteed 45 ms complete encode and decode cycle, and the highest level of integration in the industry. Changes or additions to functionality are easily achieved through remote software upgrades. Upgrades are completed without the need to remove the card from its chassis and with limited interruption to service, thus reducing onsite staffing costs. All VS901 modules are certified to stringent US-based carriers` NEBS Level 3 requirements for operation in harsh environments. "Broadcasters are overwhelmingly recognizing-and choosing-the benefits of JPEG2000," said Eugene Keane, president of Nevion USA. "The VS901 series delivers integrated benefits like no other JPEG2000 products in the industry, offering low latency, high value and resource savings that are unmatched in today`s market." About Nevion Nevion is a video transport solution provider for broadcasters, telecommunications service providers and government entities worldwide. With the most flexible and scalable video processing and transport over any network, Nevion puts power, reliability and quality behind global media transport solutions. Its Ventura, Flashlink and VikinX product lines plus management and control solutions deliver the full range of content transport, signal processing, routing solutions, and complete element and system monitoring. With the lowest carbon footprint in the industry, Nevion products are the greenest of their kind, reducing customers` operational expenses and benefiting the environment. Nevion maintains its world headquarters in Sandefjord, Norway and U.S. headquarters in Oxnard, CA, with global offices in Singapore, Dubai, and the United Kingdom. For more information, please visit www.nevion.com. McFarland MediaWorks Melanie Crandall, +1-310-739-0955 Melanie@mcFarlandMediaWorks.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: Chevron, Mascoma enter ethanol feedstock agreement
entry.body:
WASHINGTON Sept 14 (Reuters) - Biofuels company Mascoma Corp said on Monday it has entered a two-year feedstockagreement with a unit of Chevron Corp (CVX.N) that will help it make advanced cellulosic ethanol.

Mascoma hopes to produce commercial levels of cellulosic ethanol, an advanced biofuel made from the woody bits of nonfood crops, by 2013. It already makes small amounts of the fuel at a pilot plant in Rome, New York.

Under the agreement Chevron Technology Ventures (CTV), a unit of Chevron, will provide lignocellulosic feedstock to Mascoma, which will then covert them to cellulosic fuel.

Mascoma will then supply CTV with lignin, an energy-rich chemical compound derived from woody biomass, which the company will then evaluate for potential uses.

"The upgrading of our byproduct lignin to high value transportation fuels is an important step in our effort to prove the effectiveness of integrated biorefineries," Jim Flatt, the president of Mascoma said in a release.

Mascoma would not immediately say how much money was involved in the agreement.

Oil companies have been forming links with companies that make ethanol and biodiesel as U.S. mandates call for increasing amounts of biofuels to be mixed into the country's gasoline and diesel.

Currently no commercial levels of cellulosic are made in the United States, though the government requires the blending of 100 million gallons of the fuel in 2010.

(Reporting by Timothy Gardner; Editing by David Gregorio)

entry.headline: SoBran Signs Multi-Year Contract to Provide Animal Husbandry at Walter Reed Army Institute of Research/Naval Medical Research Center
entry.body: FAIRFAX, Va.--(Business Wire)-- SoBran, Inc., one of the nation`s premier biomedical research support organizations, has signed a multi-year contract to provide animal husbandry and support services at the prestigious Walter Reed Army Institute of Research/Naval Medical Research Center (WRAIR/NMRC) at the Forest Glen Annex in Silver Spring, MD. SoBran will provide the animal husbandry management, quality control, staffing, and operational functions needed to support the Division of Veterinary Medicine. "We are very excited about working with the WRAIR/NMRC," said Gregory Kelly, PhD, vice president of SoBran`s Biomedical Services Division. "Walter Reed has a long history of providing basic medical research and fundamental biological studies. We are proud to be a part of their team and hope to leverage our company`s laboratory animal experience at the National Institutes of Health and our defense contracting work to ensure the best possible animal husbandry and support services." SoBran is a diversified professional and technical services firm established in 1987. The company entered the laboratory animal research field 13 years ago and has earned a reputation for functioning as a dedicated research partner. The Biomedical Services Division provides animal research and laboratory support to a variety of governmental, academic, and institutional clients. SoBran is ISO 9001:2008-certified and has the resources to cover a wide variety of technical capabilities, handle surge support and other staffing solutions, and manage diverse programs at world-class research locations. SoBran`s duties at the WRAIR/NMRC 2-building, 150,000 square foot complex will include: * Routine animal care, husbandry, nutrition, enrichment, hygiene, and record keeping. * Sanitation and cleaning of all equipment, animal facilities, and animal support facilities. * Animal handling, restraint, standard laboratory animal procedures, technical support, and program support of animal health surveillance. * Maintenance of all related equipment; * Development and use of a quality control program to ensure compliance with all performance objectives, requirements, and thresholds; * BioSafety Level (BSL) 1 through 3 support. SoBran is proud to have been chosen to provide the animal care support and management services required for the WRAIR/NMRC research programs. We look forward to establishing a long and mutually beneficial partnership that will enable the WRAIR/NMRC to continue its groundbreaking biomedical research. About SoBran, Inc. SoBran is a rapidly growing technical and professional services company, serving government and industry since 1987. We partner with customers to solve problems affecting critical missions in biomedical research, biotechnology, preclinical research, defense, homeland security, environmental protection, and national energy policy. ISO 9001:2008 certified, SoBran brings process orientation and rigorous quality standards to all our projects. We offer services through the GSA IT, PES and LOGWORLD schedules and several GWAC contract vehicles. Headquartered in Dayton, OH, SoBran has major offices in Fairfax, VA, Burtonsville, MD, and Jacksonville, FL, with additional field offices providing direct support for federal and commercial clients. For more information, including opportunities to join the SoBran team, please visit the career section at www.sobran-inc.com. SoBran Company Contact: Nikki Dull ndull@sobran-inc.com SoBran Media Contact: Michael McDonough, 617-969-9192 mmcdonough@corporateink.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: UPDATE 2-Visa U.S. payment volume stabilizes; debit helps
entry.body:
* U.S. payment volume falls 1 pct in August

* U.S. credit volume down 10 pct; debit volume up 7 pct

* Shares up 12 cents to $72.41 (Updates with analyst comments, stock price, byline)

By Juan Lagorio

NEW YORK, Sept 14 (Reuters) - Visa Inc (V.N), the world's largest payment network, said its U.S. payment volume fell less in August than in July as more consumers used their debit cards -- a sign the industry may be stabilizing.

Visa's U.S. payment volume declined 1 percent in August compared with a year earlier. In July the drop was 2 percent.

U.S. credit volume declined 10 percent in August, compared with a 9 percent contraction in July. But debit volume grew 7 percent in August, compared with a 4 percent increase in July, Visa said in a regulatory filing.

"Instead of putting on credit, people just used the debit card instead. Consumers are more focused on controlling how much they have," said Robert Dodd, an analyst at Morgan Keegan Co. He said the Visa results were in line with his expectations.

Visa is partially insulated from the global credit crisis because it processes transactions rather than extends credit. However, revenue growth has slowed along with transaction volume as consumers try to reduce their debts.

Early this year, debit payment volumes exceeded credit payment volumes in the United States for the first time in Visa's history. The trend has intensified in recent months as more debt-burdened consumers leave their credit cards at home.

Cross-border payment volume on a constant-dollar basis fell 7 percent in August, compared with a 6 percent decline in July.

However, global processed transactions grew 9 percent in August, following a rise of 8 percent in July.

"There have been some signs that you hit and passed the bottom, and generally it makes me feel better about the card market as a whole," Dodd said.

Visa shares were up 12 cents to $72.41 in early trading on the New York Stock Exchange. (Reporting by Juan Lagorio; Editing by Lisa Von Ahn and John Wallace)

entry.headline: Microsoft Betrayed i4i, Say Court Documents
entry.body:
Microsoft Corp.marketed i4i Inc.'s XML software to potential customers at the same time it planned to drive the small company out of business by infringing on its patent for the technology, according to court documents filed last week.

In a brief submitted to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal District in Washington, Toronto-based i4i argued that an injunction blocking Microsoft from selling current versions of Word should stand.

Federal Judge Leonard Davis issued the injunction in August, barring Microsoft from selling Word 2003 and Word 2007 after Oct. 10. The decision came about three months after a Texas jury found that Microsoft had illegally used patented i4i technology to build XML features into its word processing software.

The jury had awarded i4i $200 million, but Davis increased the amount to just under $300 million when he issued the injunction.

Earlier this month, the three-judge appeals panel decided to stay the injunction while it weighs Microsoft's appeal .

I4i filed the patent infringement lawsuit in 2007. The new i4i brief charges that in 1991, "at the same time Microsoft was praising the improved functionality that i4i's product brought to Word, and touting i4i as a 'Microsoft Partner,' Microsoft was working behind i4i's back to make i4i's product obsolete."

According to the brief, just days after a 1991 meeting in which Microsoft had sought to find ways to work with i4i, Microsoft executives discussed XML plans for Word that would eventually "make obsolete any competitive attempts by third parties to conquer that market."

Microsoft must file its rebuttal to i4i's brief by Sept. 14; the appeals court is slated to hear oral arguments from the two sides on Sept. 23.

Asked to comment on i4i's briefs, a Microsoft spokesman said, "We're looking forward to the hearing on the merits of our appeal."

This version of the story originally appeared in Computerworld 's print edition.

Original story - here

entry.headline: Mascoma Announces Feedstock Processing and Lignin Supply Agreement with Chevron Technology Ventures
entry.body: LEBANON, N.H.--(Business Wire)-- Mascoma Corporation today announced that it has entered into a feedstock processing and lignin supply agreement with Chevron Technology Ventures (CTV), a division of Chevron U.S.A., Inc. Under terms of the agreement, CTV will provide various sources of lignocellulosic feedstock to Mascoma. Mascoma will then convert the feedstock to cellulosic ethanol through its proprietary process, which produces lignin as a by-product. Mascoma will provide this lignin to CTV for evaluation. "This is an important moment for us at Mascoma," said Dr. Jim Flatt, President of Mascoma. "The upgrading of our byproduct lignin to high value transportation fuels is an important step in our effort to prove the effectiveness of integrated biorefineries. It has been our goal all along to make our process as integrated and sustainable as possible." Lignin is a complex chemical compound derived from woody biomass. After biomass has been converted through Mascoma`s proprietary Consolidated Bio Processing method, which breaks down the sugars in the cellulose and turns it into ethanol, energy-rich lignin is left over. The project will last for two years, and Mascoma is hopeful that the developed technology may be suitable for a wide variety of feedstocks. In December 2008, Mascoma began creating ethanol from cellulosic biomass with positive results at its demonstration facility in Rome, New York. The company, in collaboration with its commercialization subsidiary Frontier Renewable Resources, is in the process of financing its first full-scale ethanol facility in Kinross, Michigan. The company plans to break ground on that facility during the first half of 2010. About Mascoma Mascoma Corporation is an innovative biofuels company committed to developing environmentally sustainable, low cost, low carbon biofuels from cellulosic biomass. The company`s Consolidated Bioprocessing method converts non-food biomass feedstocks into cellulosic ethanol through the use of a patented process that eliminates the need for costly enzymes and additives. The company`s corporate office and R laboratories are based in Lebanon, New Hampshire. Mascoma is producing cellulosic ethanol on a demonstration scale at its facility in Rome, New York. Its affiliate, Frontier Renewable Resources, is developing a commercial scale production facility in Kinross, Michigan. For more information, visit www.mascoma.com. Mascoma Corporation Kate Casolaro, 617-443-9933 x338 kcasolaro@rasky.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: ExxonMobil Chemical to Host Tire Symposium 2009 in Chengdu, China
entry.body: HOUSTON--(Business Wire)-- ExxonMobil Chemical will host Tire Symposium 2009, in Chengdu, China, October 18-20, for companies, organizations and media interested in learning about new tire innerliner technologies and opportunities for the Chinese tire industry. Sponsored exclusively by ExxonMobil Chemical, the event will feature product marketing and technology specialists describing tomorrow`s tire innerliner technologies that have the potential to significantly improve today`s tire performance. Exxcore DVA resin-based innerliners, for example, have the potential to reduce tire weight while being up to 10 times more effective at retaining air than conventional innerliners of the same thickness. This leading-edge inflation pressure retention (IPR) can result in tires that last longer, handle better and contribute to improved fuel economy and reduced carbon dioxide (CO2) emissions. Symposium speakers will focus on the technical advantages of new innerliner technologies as well as economic and manufacturing considerations. The conference also will provide a view on the global energy outlook and information about global tire market trends, regulatory changes and technology advances in halobutyl rubber technology. It also will highlight production process improvements and announced facility expansions that are part of the Company's commitment to reliable supply to support industry growth. "This event will give Chinese tire manufacturers a close-up view of innerliner technology that will influence the tire industry and tire manufacturing," said John W. Lyon, global vice president, Global Butyl Polymers Business Unit, ExxonMobil Chemical. "We think it's the perfect opportunity for Chinese companies to gain additional information to help put themselves at the forefront of trends and technology that can help them be more successful." Tire Symposium 2009 will be held at the Shangri-La Hotel, 9 Binjiang Dong Road, in Chengdu. Additional information and conference registration forms are available at www.tire-symposium.com. About ExxonMobil Chemical ExxonMobil Chemical is one of the world`s premier petrochemical companies with manufacturing, technology and marketing operations around the world. The company delivers a broad portfolio of products and solutions efficiently and responsibly, with a commitment to create outstanding customer and shareholder value. ExxonMobil Chemical endorses the principles of sustainable development, including the need to balance economic growth, social development and environmental considerations. To learn more, visit www.exxonmobilchemical.com. About ExxonMobil Chemical Butyl Polymer Business ExxonMobil Chemical has been at the forefront of technology and innovation in the rubber industry since inventing and patenting butyl rubber in 1937. The company markets high-quality synthetic rubber worldwide and is a global leader in butyl technology, services and products. To find out more about ExxonMobil Chemical butyl rubber, visit www.butylrubber.com. Note to Editors: 1. The terms "we," "our," "ExxonMobil Chemical" or "ExxonMobil" are used for convenience, and may include any one or more of ExxonMobil Chemical Company, Exxon Mobil Corporation, or any affiliates they directly or indirectly steward. 2. ExxonMobil, the ExxonMobil Logo, the "Interlocking X" Device and Exxcore are trademarks of ExxonMobil. ExxonMobil Chemical Jeff Neu, 281-870-6607 Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: IneoQuest Assists Microsoft(R) Mediaroom(TM) Development and Deployment With Advanced Monitoring and Troubleshooting
entry.body: MANSFIELD, MA, Sep 14 (MARKET WIRE) -- IneoQuest Technologies, Inc., the leader in High Availability video programming solutions and global provider of advanced quality and service assurance solutions for digital video, today announced the availability of two solutions that now bring complete monitoring and troubleshooting capabilities for Microsoft(R) Mediaroom(TM), from development and lab trials to full scale market deployment. IneoQuest's new IQDialogue(TM) IPTV Mediaroom(TM) Installer Edition enables service providers to easily verify turn-up and investigate issues in the field. In addition, IneoQuest has also upgraded its IQDialogue(TM) IPTV Mediaroom(TM) Advanced Edition for greater analysis and troubleshooting for Mediaroom development. With these products, IneoQuest is helping to improve Mediaroom Quality of Service (QoS) across the entire delivery chain and enable its customers to meet subscriber demands. Unlike other test and turn-up solutions available, IQDialogue IPTV Mediaroom Installer Edition is designed and optimized specifically for field use. With easy installation on any Windows laptop and an intuitive user interface, IQDialogue IPTV Mediaroom Installer Edition allows service providers to quickly and economically monitor, test and collect data about Microsoft Mediaroom deployments for IPTV, video-on-demand (VOD), and multi-room DVR services. By monitoring IP traffic across these Mediaroom services, IQDialogue IPTV Mediaroom Installer Edition provides simple pass/fail results, as well as quick and accurate fault identification, for troubleshooting. With all measurements and data saved, including channel change timing, packet loss and Instant Channel Change (ICC) signaling, deeper analysis can be conducted by tier 2/3 technicians for issues detected. Leveraging the sophisticated analysis provided by IneoQuest's IPTV Mediaroom Advanced Edition, service providers can analyze the field data and remediate issues like packet loss, D-Server communication issues, capacity problems, R-UDP fulfillment efficiency, and status messages. In addition to providing the full-scale analysis for deployment technicians, IneoQuest's IPTV Mediaroom Advanced Edition has been greatly expanded to provide Microsoft researchers and developers, its partners, and service providers' central operations staff with significantly advanced analysis and testing, monitoring, and troubleshooting capabilities. For example, IQDialogue IPTV Mediaroom Advanced Edition now goes beyond simple IPTV services to include expanded application coverage for Microsoft VOD transactions, protocols and transport; Microsoft in-home services, including multi-room DVR, signaling and status protocols; and the soon-to-be-available HomePNA testing. IQDialogue IPTV Mediaroom Advanced Edition also now supports all Microsoft RTP Header Extensions decoding, provides a Microsoft set-top box (STB) boot-up analyzer and addresses NTP decoding and analysis. These new features expand the tool's previous ability to monitor and measure channel change timing, packet loss, Instant Channel Change (ICC) signaling, and many other parameters (R-UDP, IGMP, DHCP, etc.) allowing for quick and accurate fault identification and troubleshooting. "IPTV technology is advancing rapidly with additional services and increased adoption, making development and deployment even more complex. To bring the best in quality to subscribers, every point along the delivery chain must be able to proactively monitor, analyze and troubleshoot," said Gino Dion, vice president of strategic solutions at IneoQuest. "Microsoft is one of the leaders in IPTV development and IneoQuest remains committed to providing a wide range of support tools for improving Mediaroom quality. IQDialogue IPTV Mediaroom Installer and Advanced Editions illustrate our continued focus on providing technology to help improve digital video quality." About IneoQuest Technologies IneoQuest Technologies, Inc., the leader in High Availability video programming solutions, is a global provider of advanced quality and service assurance solutions for digital video, serving customers in the telephony, cable, broadcast and network equipment industries worldwide. The company enables its customers to design, build, deploy and manage digital video networks with unique combinations of hardware, software, and services. Headquartered in Mansfield, Massachusetts, IneoQuest has sales operations in the North American, European, Asian, and Latin American regions. More information is available at www.IneoQuest.com. Contact: Amanda Munroe SHIFT Communications for IneoQuest Email Contact 617-779-1816 Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Guy Chiarello, JPMorgan Chase CIO, Joins NPower Board
entry.body: NEW YORK--(Business Wire)-- On August 6, 2009, the Board of Directors of NPower, the nation`s leading nonprofit IT services network, announced that GUY CHIARELLO, CIO of JPMorgan Chase, has recently joined its Board of Directors. "Guy has been an outstanding advisor and tremendous supporter of NPower through his service on our CIO Council. His visionary leadership will add to our impressive roster of Board members; and we are delighted that he has joined our team," said Chris Wearing, an Accenture executive and Chairman of NPower`s Board of Directors. Mr. Chiarello is the Chief Information Officer for JPMorgan Chase with worldwide responsibility for the firm`s Information Technology functions. He joined the firm in November 2007 and is a member of its Executive Committee. Before joining JPMorgan Chase, Mr. Chiarello was Chief Technology Officer and Chief Information Officer for Morgan Stanley for seven years. He joined Morgan Stanley in 1984 and served in a number of senior roles across Software Development, Technology Infrastructure and Business Strategy over the majority of his 23 years. Mr. Chiarello began his career in information technology in 1981 with the Treasury Department for the State of New Jersey. Over the past 10 years, Mr. Chiarello has been active as an executive advisor for leading public and private technology companies on business strategy and technology innovation. He has garnered Industry and Private Sector recognition through various awards including; Top Financial IT Executive in 2009 by CIO Forum, 2008 CIO of the Year by NASSCOM, Computerworld Premier 100 Leaders in 2006, and a special Alumni Citation Award from the College of New Jersey. "Guy has always shown a commitment to giving back to the community with his time, his leadership and his hands-on involvement in a range of valuable efforts," said Stephanie Cuskley, CEO of NPower. "He is a great addition to our Board." Mr. Chiarello is currently a technology advisor to PENCIL and on the Executive Board of the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society of New Jersey. NPower is the largest nonprofit IT services network in the U.S. With eleven local affiliates, NPower`s goal is to build healthier, more vibrant and sustainable communities by helping other nonprofits leverage the power of IT. To date, NPower has served more than 20,000 nonprofits nationwide. This communication is for information purposes only. It is not intended as an offer or solicitation for the purchase or sale of any financial instrument or as an official confirmation of and transaction. All market prices, data and other information are not warranted as to completeness or accuracy and are subject to change without notice. Any comments or statements made herein do not necessarily reflect those of JPMorgan Chase & Co., its subsidiaries and affiliates. entry.headline: Ingersoll Rand to Present at J.P. Morgan Diversified Industries Conference
entry.body: SWORDS, Ireland--(Business Wire)-- Ingersoll-Rand plc (NYSE:IR) announced today that Michael W. Lamach, president and chief operating officer of Ingersoll Rand, will discuss the company's long-term strategy, starting at 2:30 p.m., EDT, Tuesday, September 15, at the J.P. Morgan Diversified Industries Conference in New York, NY. The presentation will be accessible via live webcast on the Ingersoll Rand web site at http://www.ingersollrand.com and on the J.P. Morgan Diversified IndustriesConference web site at: http://metameetings.com/webcasts/jpmorgan/industries09/directlink?ticker=IR. An archive of the presentation slides will be available for 30 days following the event on the Ingersoll Rand web site. Ingersoll Rand is a global diversified industrial firm providing products, services and solutions to enhance the quality and comfort of air in homes and buildings, transport and protect food and perishables, secure homes and commercial properties, and enhance industrial productivity and efficiency. Driven by a 100-year-old tradition of technological innovation, we enable companies and their customers to create progress. For more information, visit www.ingersollrand.com. Ingersoll Rand Paul Dickard (Media) 732-652-6712 or Joe Fimbianti (Analysts) 732-652-6718 Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: The Radicati Group Will Host Webconference on Microsoft Exchange Server E2010
entry.body: PALO ALTO, CA, Sep 14 (MARKET WIRE) -- Speakers from Microsoft, EMC, HP, Intermedia.net, and USA.NET will discuss Microsoft Exchange Server 2010 (also known as Exchange 2010). Microsoft describes Exchange 2010 as "the cornerstone of Microsoft's Unified Communications solution delivering the widest range of deployment options, the richest user experience, and unprecedented information protection and control capabilities." Due to be released in late 2009, Exchange 2010 will be available for deployment as an on-premises platform, a hosted solution, or a mix of both. Exchange 2010 will add powerful capabilities for archiving and compliance, increased flexibility and reliability, and anywhere access. This webconference will provide a brief overview of Exchange 2010, and will bring together a speaker panel of Microsoft partners to discuss how they see it meeting evolving market needs. The Webconference will be moderated by Sara Radicati and will feature guest speakers from Microsoft, EMC, HP, Intermedia, and USA.NET. This Webconference is intended for IT Professionals, Investors, Product Managers, Marketing Managers or Sales Professionals from Software Vendors, Equipment Vendors or Service Providers who need to make informed decisions about the messaging and collaboration market. This is a free web event. To register please visit our web site at http://www.radicati.com. About The Radicati Group, Inc. The Radicati Group covers all aspects of e-mail security, e-mail archiving, regulatory compliance, wireless technologies, web services, identity management, instant messaging, unified communications, VoIP, and more. The company provides quantitative and qualitative information, including detailed market size, installed base and forecast information on a worldwide basis, as well as detailed country breakouts. The Radicati Group works with corporate organizations to assist them in selecting the right products and technologies to support their business needs, as well as with vendors to define the best strategic direction for their products. We also work with investment firms on a worldwide basis to help them identify and assess investment opportunities. The Radicati Group, Inc. is headquartered in Palo Alto, CA, with a European office in London, UK. Contact: Todd Yamasaki The Radicati Group, Inc. (650) 322-8059 Email Contact Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Attachmate Reflection 2008, EXTRA! and INFOConnect Solutions Achieve Compatible With Microsoft Windows 7 Logo
entry.body: SEATTLE, WA, Sep 14 (MARKET WIRE) -- Attachmate Corporation today announced that Attachmate(R) Reflection(R) 2008 along with Attachmate EXTRA!(R) and INFOConnect(R) solutions have received the Compatible with Microsoft(R) Windows(R) 7 logo. This certification enables Attachmate to offer its customers a seamless, easy-to-manage IT environment, robust desktop security features and enhanced end-user productivity. "Our ISV community is alive with innovation, and we're committed to helping our partners drive the next generation of software experiences," said Ross Brown, vice president of ISV and Solutions Partners for the Worldwide Partner Group at Microsoft. "Adding compatibility for the latest Microsoft operating systems helps ISVs to stay ahead of the competition and gives their customers access to cutting-edge technologies." Attachmate is the first host connectivity vendor to secure the Compatible with Windows 7 logo and was also the first in its category to achieve Certified for Windows Vista(R) status. The company's solutions are supported on a variety of Microsoft platforms such as Windows Server 2008, XP, Windows Vista and Windows 7 to offer customers maximum flexibility as they migrate at their own pace. In addition to multi-platform support, a variety of flexible deployment options and migration tools minimize the costs of migration and allow organizations to easily standardize on a host connectivity solution. "Attachmate is fully committed to providing our customers with the most powerful and comprehensive Windows 7-ready technology available," said Eric Varness, vice president of marketing at Attachmate. "As organizations look to re-fresh their end-user platforms and keep business critical applications secure, they're evaluating host connectivity vendors that leverage Microsoft's unparalleled security, productivity and management capabilities. By offering support for a variety of Windows operating systems, we're helping these organizations maximize host assets no matter what combination of Windows platform they support." In anticipation of the upcoming release of Windows 7, Attachmate has launched a Windows 7 resource Web page to assist customers with determining which Attachmate solutions to deploy on the Windows 7 platform. For more information please visit the Attachmate Information Center for Windows 7 at www.attachmate.com/Products/win-7-info-ctr.htm. About Attachmate Attachmate delivers advanced software for terminal emulation, application integration, and secure communications. Our NetIQ business provides solutions for automating IT processes and managing the performance, security, and compliance of your distributed IT. With our technologies, more than 65,000 businesses worldwide are putting their IT assets to work in new and meaningful ways. Attachmate has been helping businesses extend, manage, and secure their IT investments for more than 26 years. Headquartered in Seattle, Wash., Attachmate has offices and partners all over the globe. We are widely recognized for our innovative products, easy business transactions, and exceptional customer service. For more information please visit www.attachmate.com. Copyright 2009 Attachmate Corporation. All Rights Reserved. Attachmate, the Attachmate logo, Reflection, and EXTRA! are registered trademarks of Attachmate Corporation in the U.S. INFOConnect is a registered trademark of Unisys Corp. in the USA. Microsoft, Windows and Windows Vista are registered trademarks of Microsoft Corp. in the USA and other countries. All other products or service names mentioned herein are the trademarks of their respective owners. For more information, press only: Melissa Liton Communique PR for Attachmate Email Contact (206) 282-4923 ext 122 Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.headline: Sybase and IBM Collaborate to Further Global Mobile Commerce Opportunity
entry.body: Industry Leaders Sign Global Agreement for Joint Initiative Targeting Market Worth More Than USD 250 billion by 20121 HONG KONG--(Business Wire)-- Sybase, Inc. (NYSE:SY), an industry leader in delivering enterprise and mobile software, today announced that it has entered into a global agreement with IBM to target the mobile commerce opportunity with both hosted and on-premise solutions in developed and emerging markets. "This global alliance should enable Sybase and IBM to deploy mCommerce solutions at a scale that will give them a distinct advantage in the mCommerce landscape, further legitimizing the mobile channel as a core growth area for businesses worldwide," said Nick Holland, Senior Analyst, Aite Group. As mCommerce moves beyond early adopters, IBM`s global reach, strong client relationships and deep industry expertise, coupled with Sybase`s leading end-to-end mCommerce solution and unrivalled global operator reach and Financial Services customer base, the companies will be able to provide flexibility and choice of mobile banking, mobile payment and mobile remittance offerings to an increasing number of customers. "This agreement not only extends the long term collaboration between our two companies, but also coincides with the launch of IBM`s Banking Framework, a unified platform to help accelerated transformation and reduced project risk right across a bank`s operations from risk management to mCommerce," said Ranjit Balaram, Practice Executive, Wireless & Emerging Technology Applications, IBM Global Business Services. "With access to Sybase`s complete mCommerce solution, the breadth of the IBM Banking Framework and the global reach and expertise of IBM Global Services, we can help simplify deployments for our joint clients and help them introduce a more consistent experience for end-users." Today, Sybase and IBM are already trusted and proven business partners for hundreds of the world`s enterprises, mobile operators and financial institutions. Under this agreement, IBM Global Business Services and Sybase 365 mCommerce team (Sybase 365 is a subsidiary of Sybase, Inc.) will work together to extend their reach and meet the needs of even more clients. "This relationship between Sybase and IBM furthers our strategy to build global partnerships that will ensure a secure mobile commerce eco-system benefitting mobile subscribers, mobile operators and financial institutions around the world." said Matthew Talbot, Vice President mCommerce, Sybase 365. "We are pleased that IBM - our selected outsourcing partner - is teaming up with Sybase 365 to provide a full mCommerce portfolio," said Dr. Nikolai Dobberstein, Senior Vice President and Head of Strategy & New Businesses for Maxis. "Today, Maxis is using the Sybase 365 Brand Mobiliser to set up interactive mobile services integrating existing charging and payment channels, and we see further potential to strategically expand mCommerce services to our subscribers working with Sybase 365 and IBM." For further information and demonstrations, visit IBM at Stand 1E15 and Sybase at Stand 1F13, during SIBOS Hong Kong 2009. About IBM For more information go to www.ibm.com/financialmarkets About Sybase Sybase is an industry leader in delivering enterprise and mobile software to manage, analyze and mobilize information. We are recognized globally as a performance leader, proven in the most data-intensive industries and across all major systems, networks and devices. Our information management, analytics and enterprise mobility solutions have powered the world`s most mission-critical systems in financial services, telecommunications, manufacturing and government. For more information, visit http://www.sybase.com. Read Sybase blogs: http://blogs.sybase.com. About Sybase 365 Sybase 365, a subsidiary of Sybase, Inc. (NYSE:SY), is the global leader in enabling mobile information services for mobile operators, financial institutions and enterprises. We provide our customers with the widest offering in SMS, MMS and GRX interoperability, end-to-end mobile commerce solutions, innovativetext messaging, mobile marketing and content delivery services. Sybase 365 processes more than one billion messages per day, reaching 800 operators and 3.4 billion subscribers around the world. For more information, visit: www.sybase.com/365. Read our blogs: http://blogs.sybase.com Sybase and Sybase 365 are trademarks or registered trademarks of Sybase, Inc. All other company and product names mentioned may be trademarks of the respective companies with which they are associated. indicates registration in the United States. Forward-Looking Statements Certain statements in this release concerning Sybase, Inc. and its prospects and future growth are forward-looking and involve a number of uncertainties and risks. Factors that could cause actual events or results to differ materially from those suggested by these forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, the performance of the global economy and growth in software industry sales; market acceptance of the company's products and services; customer and industry analyst perception of the company and its technology vision and future prospects; the success of certain business combinations engaged in by the company or by competitors; political unrest or acts of war; possible disruptive effects of organizational or personnel changes; and other factors described in Sybase, Inc.`s reports filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, including its annual report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2007. 1 According to independent research/analyst firm, Edgar Dunn & Company Sybase 365 Shahzia Banth, 925-487-7139 shahzia.banth@sybase.com or Incisor Communications (for Sybase 365) Ana Brekalo, 415-365-0389 ana.brekalo@incisorpr.com or IBM Bill Mew, +44-780-824-7932 mewb@uk.ibm.com Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: IBM and ISB Partner to Create Research 'Collaboratory' for Service Science
entry.body: NEW DELHI, INDIA, Sep 14 (MARKET WIRE) -- IBM (NYSE: IBM) and the Indian School of Business (ISB) announced today that they have established a research 'Collaboratory' at the ISB campus for furthering research in service science. IBM and ISB have been working closely on service science research for the last few years. This Collaboratory marks the beginning of a new phase of an expanded relationship between the two organisations. Speaking on the setting up of the Collaboratory, Ajit Rangnekar, Dean, ISB, said, "We expect Services Management to be a huge area of focus for leading companies, and we are delighted to collaborate with IBM on this initiative. In keeping with the ISB's emphasis on research, we believe our association will develop innovative solutions to enhance the way services are rendered." An IBM Collaboratory is a laboratory where IBM researchers co-locate with a university, government, or commercial partner to share skills, assets, and resources to achieve a common research goal. Speaking on the need for this Collaboratory, Dr. Guruduth Banavar, Director, IBM Research - India, said, "Innovation is needed to address the world's greatest challenges and opportunities; and the responsibility must be shared among industry, government and academia. Meeting market demands for higher service quality and innovation while increasing the efficiency of service delivery requires deep insight into advances in information technology and management sciences. This Collaboratory will expand our expertise in these areas to further differentiate IBM's services offerings in the global marketplace." The newly established Collaboratory for service science will initially have a team of 10 full-time researchers, five each from ISB and IBM Research - India. The team will focus on developing foundational techniques in service science, including the modeling, measurement, and optimization of "service systems." Service research is multi-disciplinary and many variations exist today within the domains of management, operations research, and economics to name a few. While most of the existing work has focused on business-to-consumer services, the focus of this research is on business-to-business services. ISB and IBM In February 2007, IBM and ISB signed an MoU for joint research on Service Science, Management, and Engineering (SSME) in India. In May 2008, IBM India and ISB signed the first Open Collaborative Research agreement in Asia aimed at improving the competitiveness of the services sector in the region. The joint research resulted in holding workshops, publishing research papers and tutorials in the area of service science. This Collaboratory is the next step forward in their joint exploration of the area of service science. About IBM For more information about IBM Research, please visit: www.research.ibm.com About ISB The Indian School of Business (ISB) is a premier management institution established in 2001. In a short span of eight years, the ISB has successfully pioneered several new trends in management education in India and has established itself as a leading B-school across the world. The ISB has a strong pool of research oriented resident faculty and invites high calibre international faculty from reputed B-schools to teach in its Post Graduate Programme in Management/Executive Education Programmes as well as to participate in collaborative research with the resident faculty. Recently, ISB was ranked 15 in Global B-School Rankings 2009 by Financial Times, London. For further information, please contact: IBM Steven Tomasco 914-945-1655 stomasc@us.ibm.com ISB Varshaa Ratnaparke Mobile: 91-9394568018 Varsha_ratnaparke@isb.edu Copyright 2009, Market Wire, All rights reserved. -0-

entry.author: None
entry.headline: UPDATE 1-Goldman raises price targets on European auto makers
entry.body:
Sept 14 (Reuters) - Goldman Sachs raised its price targets on several European auto makers, saying the sector can continue to outperform, helped by potential positive 2010 earnings surprises that could come from an increase in sector consolidation.

"The industry is emerging from the current crisis in a substantially weaker financial position," analyst Stefan Burgstaller said in a note dated Sept. 11 to clients.

The analyst believes the industry is likely to enter a new phase of consolidation with original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) striving to achieve critical relevant scale.

"We believe the relative performance of the European automotive sector since March is the result of two drivers," Burgstaller said.

"With volume declines stabilizing, car companies were able to arrest the cash burn. Furthermore, car companies benefited from government incentive schemes, which led to better capacity utilization in the second quarter and improved working capital levels," he added.

Burgstaller reinstated Fiat FIA.MI as "buy", and raised French car parts maker Valeo (VLOF.PA) to "neutral" from "sell". He also upgraded Autoliv (ALIVsdb.ST), world no. 1 air bag and seat belt maker, to "buy" from "neutral."

The DJ Stoxx European Autos Index .SXAP was down 1.85 percent at 228.59 by 0900 GMT on Monday.

For more details on price target changes, please double click on [ID:nWNAB8925] (Reporting by Sakshi A Mattoo in Bangalore; Editing by Jarshad Kakkrakandy)

entry.headline: JPMorgan launches $1.5 billion of 5.25 year notes
entry.body:
NEW YORK, Sept 15 (Reuters) - JPMorgan Chase Co. (JPM.N) launched a $1.5 billion issue of senior notes maturing in January 2015, increasing the size from $1 billion, said IFR, a Thomson Reuters service on Tuesday.

The 5.25-year notes were launched at 135 basis points over comparable Treasuries, IFR said.

(Reporting by John Parry and Caryn Trokie; Editing by Diane Craft)

entry.headline: JPMorgan Chase Declares Common Stock and Preferred Stock Dividend
entry.body: NEW YORK--(Business Wire)-- JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE:JPM) declared a quarterly dividend of 5 cents per share on the outstanding shares of the Corporation`s common stock. The dividend is payable on October 31, 2009, to stockholders of record at the close of business on October 6, 2009. JPMorgan Chase & Co. also declared a dividend on the outstanding shares of each of the following preferred stock issues: * 6.15% Cumulative Preferred Stock, Series E - $3.075 per share (equivalent to $0.76875 per Depositary Share) * 5.72% Cumulative Preferred Stock, Series F - $2.86 per share (equivalent to $0.715 per Depositary Share) * 5.49% Cumulative Preferred Stock, Series G - $2.745 per share (equivalent to $0.68625 per Depositary Share) * Fixed-to-Floating Rate Non-Cumulative Preferred Stock, Series I - $395.00 per share (equivalent to $39.50 per Depositary Share) The dividends for the Preferred Stock Series E, F and G are payable on October 15, 2009, and the dividends for the Preferred Stock Series I are payable on October 30, 2009, in each case to stockholders of record at the close of business on September 30, 2009. JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.0 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and commercial banking, financial transaction processing, asset management and private equity. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world`s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan, Chase, and WaMu brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com JPMorgan Chase & Co. Investors: Lauren M. Tyler, 212-270-8205 or Media: Joseph Evangelisti, 212-270-7438 Copyright Business Wire 2009

entry.headline: SolutionsDevelopers Extends Microsoft Gold Partner Service Offerings
entry.body: SolutionsDevelopers Recognized for SOA and Business Process Expertise RESTON, Va.--(Business Wire)-- The SolutionsDevelopers Corporation is pleased to announce that it has extended its Microsoft Gold Partner Program expertise to include Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) and Business Processes. The SOA and Business Process Competencies acknowledge systems integrators that build internet-based business solutions and infrastructures using Microsoft tools and software to connect information, systems, people, and processes. Microsoft Gold Certified Partners represent the highest level of competence and expertise in Microsoft technologies and have a close working relationship with Microsoft. Microsoft Competencies identify partners with expertise within a given technical business area. Each competency has multiple requirements, including professional certifications and customer references. SolutionsDevelopers` existing competencies include: * Custom Development Competency, which identifies partners that provide custom-developed solutions for application infrastructure and web development. These technologies include Windows Server, BizTalk Server, SQL Server, SharePoint Technologies, and Visual Studio. * Information Worker Competency, which recognizes partners with distinct expertise in Microsoft Office SharePoint Sever and Exchange Server. Specialties include portal integration and collaboration, enterprise content management, and search. * Data Management Competency, which acknowledges partners with a proven process for implementing analysis and reporting solutions with SQL Server technology. Based in Reston, Virginia, SolutionsDevelopers is an award-winning Microsoft Gold Partner that helps drive business performance with IT strategy, managed operations and application development services for the federal sector, commercial and association industries. The company`s innovative approach and rapid delivery framework, ARMATURE, allows for application delivery in a fraction of the time of a typical software development lifecycle. To obtain more information on SolutionsDevelopers, please visit www.solutionsdevelopers.com or call 1-866-471-5911. SolutionsDevelopers Corporation Adam Sunukjian, Marketing Director Voice/Fax: 703-674-2476 adam@solutionsdevelopers.com www.solutionsdevelopers.com Copyright Business Wire 2009
